page.title: 05Wing Village
page.content: Wing is a rural village 8 miles from Aylesbury and 2.5 miles from Leighton Buzzard. It is on the edge of Ascott Estate and Wing Park. There are adequate shops for everyday needs and schools for children from 5-16 years. There is a wide range of housing from 17th century houses to modern estates. The village caters for all age groups, having parks for the young and an old people's home for the elderly. It has extensive sports grounds. The A418 runs through the village to Aylesbury. The de Rothschild and Dormer families built some houses in Wing. The Dormer family built the almshouses which were originally used as a hospital. This was founded in 1596. Wing has three churches:a Saxon C.of E. Church, a Methodist and a Congregational Church. It also has 4 public houses,the oldest one,The Cock,being established in 1742
